revised_title: The Impact of Acids, Salts, and Bases on Excised Muscle Swelling
tldr: The author conducted experiments on excised frog muscles to understand their reaction to acids, salts, and bases. They discovered that acids and bases cause muscle swelling, while neutral salts suppress this swelling. The study also found that the iso-electric point for muscle colloids falls within a specific pH range, and that the presence of salts can have an antagonistic effect on acids and a weak antagonistic effect on bases. These findings contribute to the understanding of muscle behavior in different media.
